project.teaser: D4RUNOFF overall goal is to create a novel framework for preventing and managing diffuse pollution from urban water runoff through the data driven design of hybrid nature based solutions (NBS) adapted to the current and future risk scenarios solutions. This innovative approach...
project.objective:
D4RUNOFF overall goal is to create a novel framework for preventing and managing diffuse pollution from urban water runoff through the data driven design of hybrid nature based solutions (NBS) adapted to the current and future risk scenarios solutions. This innovative approach will support water utilities, urban planners and policy makers in defining urban runoff and storm water management plans to enhance the quality of the water discharged to water bodies, considering the Climate Change.
D4RUNOFF will have the following specific objectives (SO):
- SO1 Increase the knowledge regarding urban runoff pollution sources and the impacts through the development of novel high-resolution suspect and screening & non target screening NTS methods for Contaminants of Emerging Concern (CECs) detection and identification of the major CECs and relevant pollutantspresent in storm water source and assessing their fate in NBS
- SO2 Development of cost effective advanced online sensors for targeted CECs, metals and microplastics for improving the monitoring of the water pollution derived from urban runoff
- SO3 Enhancing the implementation of advanced preventive and mitigation strategies to reduce diffuse pollution through the development of and innovative multiple-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) methodology integrated in Geographical Information System (GIS) for hybrid NBS design
- SO4 Development of a risk assessment and mapping methodology to identify diffuse pollution hotspots for specific sites & considering climate change effects.
- SO5 Development of an AI based platform to facilitate the development of effective urban runoff and storm water management plans based on informed decisions
- SO6 Implementation and validation of D4RUNOFF approach in 3 case studies and 5 replication sites
- SO7 knowledge transfer and engagement with stakeholders, including civil society
project.title: Data driven implementation of hybrid nature based solutions for preventing and managing diffuse pollution from urban water runoff
project.keywords: Nature Based Solutions, Blue-green-grey infrastructures, Measurement methods, Contaminants Emerging Concern, Online Sensors, Risk Assessment, Decission Support System

article.title: Preventing and managing diffuse pollution from urban water runoff

article.title: Putting the climatic spotlight on stormwater run-off
Helping cities rethink their water infrastructure
Asset management for nature-based city flood resilience
Tackling urban problems with nature-based solutions
Getting people on board with natural flood prevention

article.teaser: D4RUNOFF is developing effective solutions to detect, prevent and reduce pollution in urban stormwater run-off.

result.title: Integrated online monitoring platform
result.description: Produced as a result of T2.4. Description: A prototype of integrated monitoring systems for the detection of contaminants in urban runoff composed of the sample preparation module, the detection module, the electromechanical components, the electronic control board and the firmware for data analysis/representation

result.title: Communication materials, including website
result.description: Produced as a result of T.6.1. Description Development of the communication materials of the project including; i) Communication material package and visual identity 1) Project brand and visual identity, including project flyer and rollup; 2) Website and Social media accounts created

result.title: Risk breakdown report
result.description: Graph or flowchart that attempts to account for all the risk exposure a project faces as it unfolds.

result.title: Initial Data Management Plan
result.description: Produced as a result of T7.3. Description: Plan for outlining how data will be generated, collected, stored, handled, shared, and maintained

result.title: Communication & dissemination strategy
result.description: Produced as a result of T6.1. Description: Report including the strategy of communication and dissemination for the whole project, including target audiences, key messages and channels

result.title: End-of-Life approach in permeable pavement systems: a forensic study of the particle-related pollutants retained in porous concrete and porous asphalt surface layers

details.authors: Andrés Valeri, Valerio Carlos Alessio; García Argüelles, Sara; Sañudo Fontaneda, Luis Ángel; Rodríguez Gallego, José Luis; Rodríguez Hernández, Jorge; Sierra, Carlos

result.title: Preliminary versions of suspect screening and non target screening (NTS) methods analysis
result.description: Produced as a result of T1.1, including ST1.1.1 and ST1.1.2. Description: A report including a draft of the standard operating protocol (SOP) for LC-MS based suspect screening and NTS analysis. The SOP will include a flow diagram and description of each of the steps The development of this deliverable will include collection of water samples in the 3 case studies (ST1.1.2).

result.title: Why the stormwater runoff matters
Initial policy brief to address diffuse pollution from runoff in urban areas
result.description: Produced as result of D6.5. ST6.5.1; Description: A report including; i) relevant information collected in the first part of the project regarding EU policies related with the project scope, namely, the Water Framework Directive, the Marine Strategy Framework Directive, the REACH Regulation or the Action Plan “Digital Single Market for Water Services”, among others; ii) conclusions, recommendations and orientation of further actions to be done along the project and by other stakeholders.

result.title: Standard Operating Protocols (SOP) for suspect screening and non target screening (NTS) analysis workflows for stormwater
result.description: Produced as a result of T1.1 and T.1.2, including ST1.1.1, ST1.1.2, ST1.2.1, ST1.2.2, and ST.1.2.4. Description: A report containing the final SOP for suspect screening and NTS analysis with one illustrative example of each steps using the preliminary stormwater data set.The development of this deliverable will include collection of water samples in the 3 case studies (ST1.1.2).

result.title: Intermediate progress report on the actions carried on in the case studies
result.description: Produced as result of T6.2 and T6.3. Description: A report for dissemination to stakeholders and process tracking including the relevant information regarding the case studies between M18 and M29, including its contribution to the technical developments done in WP1 to WP4 (including a summary of the developed/adapted technologies) preparation and launch of the testing actions in WP5, local event/ open days (T6.3) and also the main dissemination and communication actions.

result.title: Second intermediate update of the communication and dissemination strategy and reporting on actions done in the second project period
result.description: Produced as a result of the partial action done in T6.1 between M18 to M30. Description: Update of the strategy for communication & dissemination, including a summary activity report of the actions done between M18 to M29

result.title: Library of pollutants from urban runoff in Nature Based Solutions
result.description: Produced as a result of T1.3, including ST1.3.1, ST1.3.2 and ST1.3.3. Description: Report including a draft inventory (e.g. a database) with identified pollutants in stormwater. The inventory will contain quantitative or semi-quantitative data of the identified pollutants from the initial screening of stormwater in WP1, analytical information, and the origin of pollutants. The analytical data will, when possible, be supplemented with publicly available data on psychochemical properties. The inventory will be published as a scientific article where the data will be discussed in relation to previous findings. The development of this deliverable will include collection of water samples in the 3 case studies (ST1.3.1)

result.title: Requirements and specifications of online monitoring systems for sensors
result.description: Produced as a result of T2.1. Description: Report containing the main requirements and specifications for the sensors’ operation in the different case studies. Requirements in terms of water quality parameters, energy supply, measurement frequency, etc will be collected to be taken into account in the monitoring systems design. The development of this deliverable will use direct information on requirements collected from the entities working in the 3 case studies

result.title: Multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) for selection and location of hybrid solutions
result.description: Produced as a result of T3.3. Description: Report on mathematical methodology for customizing hybrid solutions based on the selected criteria and requirements.

result.title: Initial preparatory and testing report in case studies
result.description: Produced as result of the first set of actions implemented within T5.1, T5.2, T5.3, T.5.4, T.5.5. Description: A report including; i) a summary of the information and data obtained from the preparatory and ongoing testing activities implemented in T5.1 (involving detection methods developed in WP1), T5.2 (involving the risk assessment & risk mapping methodology developed in WP4), T5.3 (involving the online sensors developed in WP2), T.5.4 (involving the AI-Platform developed in WP4), T.5.5 (involving the MCDA developed in WP3); ii) feedback to WP1to WP4; iii) action plan for the further testing actions to be done.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - D4RUNOFF (Data driven implementation of hybrid nature based solutions for preventing and managing diffuse pollution from urban water runoff)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: Diffuse urban pollution is affecting natural waters in all of Europe. This is mainly regulated trough the EU Water Frame Directive, which includes lists of targeted chemical compounds, threshold limits and monitoring. Scientists acknowledge, that contaminants in the targeted...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Initial preparatory report on the assessment of the replicability.
result.description: Produced as result of T5.6, ST5.6.2. Description: A report including the main actions to be implemented with the cooperation of the replication sites for the assessment of the replicability, procedures, tools and action plan.

result.title: Report on co-design of the AI-Assisted Platform with stakeholders' community
result.description: Produced as a result of T4.1. Description: A report containing the paper prototypes drafted in each co-design session with the pilots. The development of this deliverable will be done with the participation of end-users in the 3 case studies

result.title: Monitoring system module for water sample preparation
result.description: Produced as a result of T2.2. Description: A prototype of the monitoring system module will be developed. It will prepare the water samples previous to the measurement in the sensors. It will perform preconcentration and sample clean-up, through the clean-up and pre-concentration modules.

result.title: Ranking of pollutants on their risk of accumulation
result.description: Produced as a result of T1.4, including ST1.4.1, ST1.4.2 and ST1.4.3 and ST1.4.4. Description; Report including a ranking of priority pollutants on the risk of accumulation in the soil matrix and the risk of break-through to the groundwater, encompassing 5 NBS and 5 contaminant classes. The development of this deliverable will include the collection of soil/sediment (ST1.4.1) and investigation of the filtration efficiency of case studies’ NBS (ST1.4.3) at the 3 case studies

result.title: Initial progress report on the actions carried on in the case studies
result.description: Produced as result of T6.2 and T6.3. Description: A report for dissemination to stakeholders and process tracking including the relevant information regarding the case studies, including its contribution to the technical developments done in WP1 to WP4 (v), co-design sessions done in WP4 for the specification of the AI-Platform, stakeholder engagement actions (open days in pilots) and also the main dissemination and communication actions.

result.title: Parametric library of Nature Based Solutions (NBS)
result.description: Produced as a result of T3.1 and T3.2. Description: Report on a complete categorised inventory of the whole urban drainage techniques designed according to parametric principles. For experts consulting and as a baseline document for the hybrid customized solutionThe practical experience with the implementation of different NBS in the 3 case studies will be used as one of the information sources for the critical review.

result.title: Report on monitoring system detection module for the detection of contaminants
result.description: Produced as a result of T2.3. Description: Report including a public summary of the characteristics of the detection module and actions done, excluding sensitive information.

result.title: Standard operating protocols (SOP) for identification in non target sceening (NTS) methods and quantification in suspect screening
result.description: Produced as a result of T1.1 and T1.2, including ST1.1.3, ST1.2.1, ST1.2.2, ST1.2.3, and ST1.2.4. A report on the SOP for the identification workflow describing confidence levels for identification (Level 1-4); and a draft of a scientific article that describes the semi-quantification workflow for LC-MS and/or GCxGC-HRMS suspect screening and NTS The development of this deliverable will include collection of water samples in the 3 case studies.

result.title: Public summary of the Geographical information system (GIS) location tool for Nature Based Solutions (NBS) hybrid solutions at city scale
result.description: Produced as a result of T3.4. Description: Report including a public summary of the characteristics of the GIS location tool for NBS hybrid solutions at city scale, and actions done, excluding sensitive information.

result.title: Initial report on clustering activities
result.description: Produced as result of D6.5, ST6.5.2. Description: A report summarizing the main clustering activities implemented in the first period of the project and including an action plan for improving the effectiveness of further clustering activities.

result.title: Analytical Chemistry

details.authors: Selina Tisler, Kristoffer Kilpinen, David I. Pattison, Giorgio Tomasi, and Jan H. Christensen

result.title: Intermediate update of the communication and dissemination strategy and reporting on actions done in the first project period
result.description: Produced as a result of the partial action done in T6.1 up to M18. Description: Update of the strategy for communication & dissemination, including an summary activity report of the actions done in the first 18 months

result.title: Interim Data Management Plan
result.description: Produced as a result of T7.3.Description: Report on how data is being generated, collected, stored, handled, shared, and maintained along the project

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
